Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: INVENTORY OBSERVATION NUMBER IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a row inthe pipe inventory table.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual peices ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT.
Column Comment.5: COUPLING or THREADING TYPE: A short length of pipe used to connect two jointsof casing. A casing coupling has internal threads (female threadform) machined tomatch the external threads (male threadform) of the long joints of casing. Thetwojoints of casing are threaded into opposite ends of the casing coupling.Synonyms: casing collar (Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary)
Column Comment.6: DAMAGED JOINT COUNT: The number, out of the total number, that are damaged.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: JOINT COUNT: The number of joints of this type counted during this inventory.These are the joints that are not installed in the well bore, but are on-site during thereporting period.
Column Comment.10: LINEAR MASS: The weight of the tubular, expressed as mass.
Column Comment.12: LOAN AUTHORIZED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier forthe business associate who authorized the loan of the joints.
Column Comment.13: LOAN COUNT: the number of joints that have been borrowed or loaned to anothersite or company. Also track who they have been loaned to.
Column Comment.14: LOAN BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate to whom the joints were loaned.
Column Comment.15: LOST COUNT: The number of joints that are reported list in this inventory.
Column Comment.16: MAXIMUM JOINT OUTSIDE DIAMETER: The outside diameter of a length of pipe,usually referring to drillpipe, casing or tubing. While there are different standardlengths, the most common drillpipe joint length is around 30 ft [9 m]. For casing, themost common length of a joint is 40 ft [12 m].
Column Comment.18: MAXIMUM OUTSIDE DIAMETER: The largest diameter of the outside of the pipe,tubular, casing etc.
Column Comment.20: MINIMUM INSIDE DIAMETER: The smallest diameter of the inside of the pipe,tubular, casing etc.
Column Comment.22: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.24: REPORT TIME: The actual time when the inventory was made, as date and timecombined.
Column Comment.25: REPORT TIME: The timezone of the Reported Time.
Column Comment.26: DRILL REPORT TIME: a list of the valid points in a reporting period, shift or tourwhen measurements and records are made. Usually, this is done at the start or endof the shift.
Column Comment.27: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.28: TUBING GRADE: the tensile strength of the tubing material. A system of classifyingthe material specifications for steel alloys used in the manufacture of tubing.
Column Comment.29: TUBING TYPE: This reference table describes the particular type of tubular or type.For example tubing, casing or liner. This is a general classification. A more specificdescription can be found in R_LINER_TYPE.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
